review name: Selling Old Product - not current version
review text: The listed ingredients on Amazon's website did not indicate it contained Xantham Gum. Upon receiving this order, The ingredients listed on the actual product included Xantham Gum. I contacted CerVe (Johnson & Johnson) and they indicated that Amazon must be selling an older version. The FDA has stated that Xantham Gum should not be in children products as it interferes with their growth. This isn't the first time that ingredients on Amazon's website differ from the ingredients in the products received. A very dangerous situation for someone with multiple food & chemical sensitvities.

review name: Great to throw in your bag for hands, neck, whatever gets dry
review text:
I have been a fan of CeraVe cream since a dermatologist recommended it more than ten years ago. Nothing seems to soothe irritated skin better, except pure petrolatum, which is too greasy to wear under makeup, for example--and CeraVe has ceramides, and I understand other ingredients, that rebuild and maintain your skin's barrier function even better than petrolatum. You can buy smaller tubes of the cream, since the big tub is, well, a big tub, and tubes are more portable, but this is probably more cost effective. It's not exactly the same formula, but it seems to have the same ceramides and most of the same ingredients but in different places in the list. I think it seems to be even richer, and makes a perfect hand cream--it has the same texture as the Aveda hand cream my salon has out, without any of the irritants.
For baby use, the tub of the original cream would be great for the changing table or bathroom counter, but this is way easier to tote, and neater!

CeraVe Baby Moisturizing Cream, 5 oz spreads smoothly, gets absorbed quickly, moisturizes well, and is not greasy. The best, most effective applications are taking it: after shower/bath, for deep moisturizing especially in dry environments (dry climate, winter, or air-conditioned/heated rooms/spaces/quarters), and against dry skin in general on daily basis maybe before sleeping. After the first use, the dry skin hydration increased the next morning resulting in a visible improvement in the skin smoothness and softness. However, the cream made the skin min. more delicate that might have been an unavoidable byproduct of its increased softness. For the same reason, the skin became min. more sensitive to touch and prone to scratch, but - at the same time - faster healing for its increased moist, as under a Band-Aid. The price is low.

review name: I wish I could bathe in this
review text: Mild enough to not feel like it's burning my skin when my psoriasis is on overdrive, but strong enough to soften those uber rough areas when flare-up occur. There's almost no scent to this cream, which I really like. It also doesn't leave behind a greasy or sticky residue as it absorbs quickly. I can even use this on my face for chapped winter skin or when my nose is irritated from all the Kleenex and blowing my nose. This cream doesn't cause any irritation or breakouts - just soothing relief from dry, cracked, chapped, rough skin. I've used CeraVe before, but this is the first time I've used the baby version, and I think I have finally - FINALLY - found my HG of lotions.

review name: Great for delicate skin; no greasy mess!
review text: This is about as non-offensive as it gets for lotions for delicate skin. The lotion is a light consistency and applies very smoothly. It soaks in effectively and does not leave any residue. There is no smell at all. I use it on my 3, 5 and 7 year old boys and it makes their skin so soft. My 7 year old specifically get hot spots of eczema on his skin and this lotion seems to really help with that. I really prefer this type to the greasy thick creams such as Aquaphor, because although those types are effective, they are a huge mess. This one is not. No complaints!!

review name: Works well at Moisturizing the skin for baby and adults!
review text: This is a great moisturizing cream. My daughter (age 1) has dry skin in the winter time from the Midwest dryness. This does a great job at leaving her skin feeling moisturized. It is fairly thick, but not difficult at all to rub on, and soaks very well into the skin. My son does have occasional patches of Eczema that can form on his skin during the winter, and though he hasn't had a breakout yet to test it on, I see that it is noted that it is accepted by the National Eczema Association.
